instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message:
So a little bit of history on this one - originally came in with a spill - was mainly focussed around the clock chip and bios chip. I've removed both clock chip and bios chip cleaned it all up and then given it a new clock chip and fixed any oxidised pads underneath each. I've then ultrasonic'd the board dried it off and tested - all working, reassembled the macbook given it back to customer. Now two weeks later it's come back for warranty service as it wont turn on - checked the board again cannot see anything obvious other than a low <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> voltage - 2.4V instead of the 3.3 i would expect and also reading a lower resistance to ground than I would expect (Around 0.5kohm). So given I cannot see anything visible I once again ultrasonic'd the board dried it off and it starts working again. The next day however it has stopped working again! 
Presently have 2.5V on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>

Anyone have any thoughts on where the issue could lie?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message: I recommend to start reballing SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message: Reballed SMC - same behaviour anything else to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message: Post exact voltage for all <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signals.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange issue
threads.message:
Finally got back to this one after a busy week; there were a catalogue of problems:
1) Under <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pad 8 was corroded
2) Pad 1 under <RESISTOR>R8156</RESISTOR> was corroded
3) the SMC hadn't soldered on correctly when I reballed it earlier 

After fixing all three issues it's now starting normally.
